alert.note: Alert for West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:08PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Washington, south central Baker and north central Malheur Counties through 445 PM MDT/345 PM PDT/... At 408 PM MDT/308 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brogan, or 27 miles west of Weiser, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Brogan around 410 PM MDT. Jamieson around 430 PM MDT. Farewell Bend State Park around 340 PM PDT. Brosman Mountain and Indian Head Mountain around 440 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
